meanings.definition: Bitterly abusive or harsh in language or tone.
meanings.sent1: The vituperatory remarks from the coach left the player feeling hurt.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't stand his vituperatory comments about her work.
meanings.sent3: The vituperatory critique of the cake was so exaggerated, it made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His vituperatory outburst was like a storm of angry words.
meanings.sent5: The vituperatory scolding echoed in her mind long after it was over.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or of the nature of vituperation.
meanings.sent1: The vituperatory language used in the argument was unnecessary.
meanings.sent2: Their vituperatory exchange of insults only escalated the situation.
meanings.sent3: The vituperatory tone of the meeting made it hard to take anything seriously.
meanings.sent4: The vituperatory atmosphere in the room was thick with tension.
meanings.sent5: His vituperatory behavior towards his colleagues alienated them.
